The Sheffield Book Fair announced today that Eva Dyson is now the inaugural winner of the £50,000 Emily Hallam Award for Fiction. The award is given annually to a British writer in the current publishing season. The biennial will be held at the Sheffield Performing Arts Centre in Sheffield on March 3. Dyson, a British writer living in New South Wales, Australia, has won three awards since she was nominated in 2016: Winner of the Emily Hallam Prize for Fiction in 2017, the 2019 Benedictine Medal for Art for Literary Writing, and the 2019 Guggenheim Medal for Literary Art. She has also been a finalist for the Turner Prize, and has been a finalist for the Laurence Olivier Prize, the London Independent Book Festival, and the Rabkin Prize for Literary Art, among other awards.
